Submodules

news.admin module

Admin configuration for the News Application. This module defines how models are displayed and managed within the Django administration interface, including custom user role management and article approval workflows.

class news.admin.ArticleAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]

Bases: ModelAdmin

Admin interface for managing news articles. Provides functionality for quick approval and filtering by publisher.

list_display = ('title', 'author', 'publisher', 'approved', 'created_at')
list_editable = ('approved',)
list_filter = ('approved', 'publisher', 'created_at')
property media
search_fields = ('title', 'content')
class news.admin.CommentAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]

Bases: ModelAdmin

Admin interface for moderating comments. Allows administrators to track which comments belong to which articles.

list_display = ('author', 'article', 'created_at')
list_filter = ('created_at', 'article')
property media
search_fields = ('text',)
class news.admin.CustomUserAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]

Bases: UserAdmin

Customizes the User management interface. Extends the standard UserAdmin to include role-based fields and many-to-many subscription relationships.

fieldsets = ((None, {'fields': ('username', 'password')}), ('Personal info', {'fields': ('first_name', 'last_name', 'email')}), ('Permissions', {'fields': ('is_active', 'is_staff', 'is_superuser', 'groups', 'user_permissions')}), ('Important dates', {'fields': ('last_login', 'date_joined')}), ('Custom Fields', {'fields': ('role', 'subscribed_publishers', 'subscribed_journalists')}))
filter_horizontal = ('groups', 'user_permissions', 'subscribed_publishers', 'subscribed_journalists')
list_display = ('username', 'email', 'role', 'is_staff')
list_editable = ('role',)
list_filter = ('role', 'is_staff')
property media
class news.admin.NewsletterAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]

Bases: ModelAdmin

Admin interface for managing newsletters. Facilitates the grouping of multiple articles into a single newsletter using a horizontal filter interface.

filter_horizontal = ('articles',)
list_display = ('title', 'author', 'created_at')
list_filter = ('author', 'created_at')
property media

news.api_views module

API Views for the News Application. This module defines the RESTful API endpoints using Django Rest Framework, including custom permissions and specialized actions for article approval and subscription-based feeds.

class news.api_views.ArticleViewSet(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelViewSet

ViewSet for handling Article logic including creation, retrieval, and administrative approval.

approve(request, pk=None)[source]

Approve article and send emails to followers.

get_permissions()[source]

Role-based access control for different API actions.

get_queryset()[source]

Return only approved articles for list/retrieve.

perform_create(serializer)[source]

Assign the current user as the author upon article creation.

queryset = <QuerySet [<Article: New Tech Breakthrough>, <Article: Xbox Upcoming>, <Article: New Nintendo Switch 3>, <Article: The Future of Gaming: PlayStation 6 Rumors Heat Up>, <Article: Test Article for Option 2>]>
serializer_class

alias of ArticleSerializer

subscribed(request)[source]

Retrieve articles from journalists or publishers followed by the user.

class news.api_views.IsAuthorOrEditor[source]

Bases: BasePermission

Allow authors of an object or editors to edit/delete it.

has_object_permission(request, view, obj)[source]

Determine if the user is the owner of the object or an editor.

class news.api_views.IsEditor[source]

Bases: BasePermission

Allows access only to Editors or Superusers.

has_permission(request, view)[source]

Check if the requesting user has editor or admin privileges.

class news.api_views.IsJournalist[source]

Bases: BasePermission

Allows access only to users with the Journalist role.

has_permission(request, view)[source]

Check if the requesting user has journalist privileges.

Allow Journalists/Editors to manage content; others just view.

news.apps module

Application configuration for the News app. This module handles app initialization and ensures that Django signals are properly registered when the application starts.

class news.apps.NewsConfig(app_name, app_module)[source]

Bases: AppConfig

Configuration class for the News application. Sets the default primary key type and triggers signal registration.

default_auto_field = 'django.db.models.BigAutoField'
name = 'news'
ready()[source]

Override the ready method to import signals. This is necessary to ensure signal handlers are connected when the application registry is fully populated.

news.models module

Models for the News Application. This module defines the data schema for Users (with role-based permissions), Articles, Comments, and Newsletters.

class news.models.Article(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a news article created by a Journalist. Requires approval by an Editor before becoming publicly visible.

approved

Status indicating if the article is live.

Type:

bool

publisher

The editor who oversaw the publication.

Type:

User

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

exception NotUpdated

Bases: ObjectNotUpdated, DatabaseError

approved

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

author

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

author_id
comments

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_reverse_many_to_one_manager() defined below.

news.serializers module

Serializers for the News Application API. This module converts complex model instances into JSON format for REST API consumption and handles validation for incoming data.

class news.serializers.ArticleSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for the Article model providing a flat representation. Includes read-only fields for author and publisher names to improve response readability.

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

fields = ['id', 'title', 'content', 'author', 'author_name', 'publisher', 'publisher_name', 'approved', 'created_at']

model

news.signals module

Signals for the News Application. This module handles automated tasks triggered by database events, specifically managing user permissions by synchronizing custom roles with Django Auth Groups.

news.signals.assign_user_to_group(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)[source]

Signal receiver that automatically assigns a User to a Django Group based on their assigned ‘role’ (READER, JOURNALIST, or EDITOR).

This ensures that built-in Django permission management stays in sync with the custom role field.

news.tests module

Unit tests for the News Application API. This module contains test cases to verify role-based access control, article creation, approval workflows, and subscription-based content filtering.

class news.tests.NewsAPITests(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: APITestCase

Test suite for News API endpoints. Covers authentication, authorization, and business logic for different user roles.

setUp()[source]

Initialize the test database with users, articles, and subscription relationships before each test method.

Verify unauthenticated users cannot access subscribed feed.

Verify Editor can approve and it triggers the mocked email.

Verify Editor has delete authority over any article.

Reader restricted from creating articles.

class news.tests.NewsWebTemplateTests(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: TestCase

Test suite for Frontend/Web template logic. Ensures that sensitive UI elements (like Approve buttons) are hidden based on user roles.

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

Verify Journalists cannot see the ‘Approve & Publish’ button.

news.urls module

URL configuration for the news app. Defines routes for article viewing, editor dashboards, and user subscriptions.

news.views module

Frontend View Logic for the News Application. This module handles all web-based interactions including article management, newsletter curation, user subscriptions, and editor approval workflows.

news.views.add_comment(request, article_id)[source]

Allow authenticated users to post comments on approved articles.

news.views.approve_article(request, article_id)[source]

Handles the retrieval and display of a single news article.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • article_id (int) – The primary key of the article to display.

Raises:

Http404 – If the article is unapproved and the user is not the author or an editor.
